184036-d-02-12-04-DH.Narrative: TRAIN 167-11 TRAVELING NORTH ON THE SINGLE MAIN TRACK AT APPROXIMATELY 18 MPH WENT INTO EMERGENCY ATMP 671.  CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND CARS 18 THROUGH 28 DERAILED.  CARS WERE UPRIGHT AND INLINEUPDATE FROM TRAIN ACCIDENT AND PREVENTION TEAM:  ENSURE DOWNLOAD OF EVENT RECORDERS IS FROM ALL UNITS INVOLVED C/W TONNAGE PROFILES AND TRAIN CONSIST PLUS A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION OF HOW THE TRAIN WASBEING HANDLED AND ANY SERVICE AREA SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS AND CREW INTERVIEWS.  PRELIMINARY CAUSE ISBEING SHOWN AS M204, IMPROPERLY LOADED CAR.  UPDATE 4/8/04:  TRAIN ACCIDENT PREVENTION TEAM AND NEUSMANAGERS AGREED TO CAUSE M405, INTERACTION OF LATERAL/VERTICAL FORCES, (INCLUDING HARMONIC ROCK OFF).

040201-d-02-17-04-DL.Contributing Accident Cause: Other track geometry defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
040201-d-02-17-04-DL.Narrative: RE LINES 38,39: POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE AT A LOCATION OF A FORMER SWITCH (REMOVED 2002) WHERE A SHORE PIECE OF RAIL WAS ADDED, CAUSING A NON-STAGGERED IRREGULAR ALIGNMENT OF JOINT STRUCTURE ON THIS SECTION OF CURVED MAIN TRACK.EXCESSIVE LATERAL FORCE AT THE JOINT CAUSED ONE WHEELSETOF THE 11TH CAR TO CLIMB.  ANALYSIS OF TRACKBED REVEALED THAT ONE WHEELSET WAS AS THE ONLY PORTIONOF THE CAR THAT DERAILED, AND THE TRAIN TRAVELED FOUR MILES TO THE NEXT FACING POINT SWITCH AT MP 131,45, WHERE THE TRAIN LINE SEVERED AFTER DERAILING 14 MORE CARS, BRINGING THE TRAIN TO A STOP.  FOURHAZARDOUS EMPTY CARS POSITIONED AT THE IMMEDIATE REAR THE TRAIN WERE NOT INVOLVED.

THE LRWN 102 IS AN ALCO C-420 WITH A FUEL TANK CAPACITY OF 2500 GALLONS.  PERSONNEL FROM THE INDUSTRY CONTAINED THE LEAKING FUEL, NOTIFIED THE EPA AND OTHER EMERGENCY AGENCIES, PICKED UP AND DISPOSED OF THE DIESEL FUEL WITH THE INSPECTION AND APPROVAL OF THE EPA.  THERE WAS NO FIRE, EVACUATIONS OR ENVIRONMENTAL CONSEQUENCES RESULTING FROM THIS DERAILMENT.

AT APPROXIMATELY MP 201 WHEN TRAIN BEGAN DECENT OF 3% GRADE, THE SPEED BEGAN TO INCREASE OVER THE 10MPH SPEED LIMIT AT MP 201.6. AT MP 201.1 THE TRAIN WAS PLACED INTO EMERGENCY. THE TRAIN SPEED CONTINUED TO INCREASE AFTER TRAIN WAS PLACED INTO EMERGENCY.  THE ENGINEER & CONDUCTOR JUMPED FROM THE TRAIN AND THE TRAIN CONTINUED DOWN GRADE WHEN IT REACHED A LEFT HAND CURVE AND CARS 2 THROUGH 18 OF THETRAIN DERAILED TO THE SOUTH AND NORTH SIDE OF THE RIGHT OF WAY. 183938-d-02-03-04-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 297 WAS PULLING WEST INTO LACROSSE YARD TRACK #3 WHEN DRAGGING EQUIPMENT (BRAKE RIGGING) ON CAR JRSX 6017 CAUSED CAR TO DERAIL ALONG WITH CAR JRSX 6009.  THE DERAILED CARS MADE CONTACT WITH EASTEND OF CAR SOO 115768 WHICH WAS ON TRACK #4.   THIS THEN CAUSED CARS ON TRACK #4 TO MOVE WEST AND INTO THE SIDE OF THE TRAIN 297 AT THE WEST END OF #3 TRACK. CARS ON WEST END OF #4 TRACK THAT SUSTAINED DAMAGE - CP 388261 TIPPED OVER, NAHX 82378 DERAILED. CARS ON WEST END OF #3 TRACK - SOO 119938 DAMAGED, SOO 119186 CORNERED. CAUSE: BRAKE BEAM & RIGGING FELL DOWN ON RAILCAR JRSX 6017 CAUSING CAR TO DERAIL AT A SELF GUARDED SWITCH & DERAILED CAR AHEAD OF IT. TRAVELING DOWN A TRACK & STRIKING CARSON ADJACENT TRACK THEN SHOVING INTO ITSELF AT THE OTHER END OF YARD TRACK. FRA AUDIT 3/06 IDENTIFIED INCIDENT AS HAVING LOW COSTS & POTENTIALLY FRA REPORTABLE. 3/1/06 ENGINEERING CONFIRMED $80 TRACKCOSTS - TRACK COSTS ARE CORRECT, WE HAD VERY LITTLE TRACK DAMAGE, ONLY LABOR COSTS' 5/5/06 - MECHANICAL - REVIEWED REPAIR COSTS OF ALL EQUIPMENT INVOLVED AND PROVIDED UPDATES, WHICH NOW MAKES THIS FRAREPORTABLE.

184073-d-02-13-04-SOO.Narrative: AT 23:40, TRAIN 286-13 WAS STOPPED BY THE TRACK SIDE WARNING DETECTOR LOCATED AT M. 299.2.  UPON INSPECTION, CONDUCTOR FOUND THE 46TH CAR BEHIND THE ENGINES, CPAA 207341, LOAD OF BEANS, HAD BURNED OFFTHE JOURNAL ON THE WEST SET OF TRUCKS, EAST WHEEL.  THE BRAKE RIGGING WAS ALSO DOWN AND DAMAGED THETRACK SIDE WARNING DETECTOR AND THE BOLSTER WAS DOWN AS WELL.    CAUSE DETERMINATION:  JOURNAL RANWARM AND LOST THE LUBRICATING GREASE WHICH LED TO JOURNAL FAILURE
